definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
hatred/animosity/enmity/foe/enemy/to feel animosity toward (the wealthy, foreigners etc)

sentences.english: You will be extremely sentimental, and if pushed by others you may hold a lasting grudge.
sentences.chinese: 你會非常敏感，如果別人惹了你，你可能會記仇。
它天性還記仇，並且殘忍。

sentences.english: It's not a time for grudges.
Don't hold a grudge, hold a grudge will affect your judgment in life.
sentences.chinese: 別去記仇，記仇會影響你對生活的判斷。

sentences.english: Don't hold a grudge, hold a grudge will affect your judgment in life.
sentences.chinese: 別去記仇，記仇會影響你對生活的判斷。

sentences.english: I this person never, generally have a single game called revenge.
sentences.chinese: 我這人從不記仇，一般有仇單場就報了。

sentences.english: 18my people never hold a grudge against me, generally on the spot report.
sentences.chinese: 我這人從不記仇，一般有仇我就當場報了。

sentences.english: But of course there's a keen rivalry.
sentences.chinese: 但是一定會有一個記仇的對手。

definition: to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
to be softhearted/to be tenderhearted/to be kindhearted
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
to like to look good in the eyes of others/sensitive about how one is regarded by others/proud
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
